title: Anatomy-Clinical Integration Module: Practice-Centered Education Applying the 5-E Strategy and ARCS Motivation Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Anatomy and Clinical Practice Experience
context.additional_context: Clinically integrated education for current practitioners emphasizing smartphone-based learning activities

learning_goals: Learners enhance their ability to apply anatomical knowledge to clinical cases through the 5-E strategy (Engage-Explore-Explain-Elaborate-Evaluate).
Learners achieve attention (4.7+/5.0), relevance (4.7+/5.0), confidence, and satisfaction in anatomy learning through ARCS motivation theory-based activities.

Learners can analyze three real clinical scenarios (e.g., surgical planning, patient status evaluation, treatment option comparison) in a 4th-week project assessment during a 6-month course and create a simulation report that accurately presents decision-making rationales using anatomical knowledge (muscle/bone/organ structures) with at least 80% accuracy.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
